work.name: Institute of Physics (IOP)
work.summary: Mentor for Year 12 students in the Improving Gender Balance (IGB) research trial of the Institute of Physics. Supporting the development of young and underrepresented people in their physics academic path.

Developed a professional relationship with the mentee.

work.name: Scottish Centre for the Application of Plasma‑based Accelerators (SCAPA)
work.summary: Worked with a research team studying Laser‑Wakefield Acceleration to generate high acceleration gradients by harnessing the power of a 350 TW ultra‑short laser.
highlights: Used target characterisation techniques to measure the density profile of a gas nozzle using wavefront sensors.
Performed a Particle in Cell (PIC) simulation in EPOCH to analyse the laser‑wakefield behaviour.

volunteer.summary: We organise networking, and outreach events for students and academics in the field of optics and photonics at the University of Glasgow

highlights: Organised several talks with S1 students at Smithycroft Secondary School focused on Climate Change, Meteorology, Environmental Protection and Recycling.

volunteer.position: President of the Strathclyde Physics Society

Organised a plethora of social events, including trips, programming workshops, Q&As with students and Physics News Articles on social media.

projects.name: Theoretical Modelling of Magneto‑Optical Traps
projects.summary: Wrote a numerical model in Python to predict the number of atoms trapped in a standard 87 Rb MOT. Performed multi‑variable optimisation to find trap parameters and increase efficiency. Expanded on the theoretical understanding of Grating Magneto‑Optical Traps to further develop an accurate model.
highlights: Technical Skills: Python (Matplotlib, NumPy, SciPy, SymPy), Jupyter Notebook, Git, LaTeX typesetting.
Soft Skills: Time Management, Presentation skills, Report writing.

projects.name: Magneto‑Optical Trap Modelling
projects.summary: Analysed the behaviour of a standard 6‑beam MOT taking a numerical approach from first principles. Established physical relationships between trap parameters in order to optimise for a large number of atoms. Studied modern approaches to achieve miniaturisation for use of cold atomic clouds in a range of applications, such as the Pyramid MOT (PMOT) and the Grating MOT (GMOT) developed at Strathclyde.
highlights: Technical Skills: Python (Matplotlib, NumPy, SciPy, SymPy), LaTeX typesetting.
Soft Skills: Critical Thinking, Time Management, Presentation skills, Report writing.
